description: A very interesting work-in-progress

Much better than the combination of the Disk Usage Analyzer and System Monitor. This app will be a great replacement for both of these apps. In particular, it appears to be very fast, minimal and responsive. This app will be a great replacement for both of these apps. In particular, it appears to be very fast, minimal and responsive.

minimal implementation software that combines the functionality of the disc usage analyzer and the system monitor with a touch of the terminal htop feel. tested on fedora 28 on gnome 3.28. looking forward to the feature expansion and maturing of the gnome usage app.

The graph speeds to the left faster than it can draw, and it disappears entirely within 10 seconds. I have a hunch that it's because of my 144hz refresh rate. Funny bug, but not willing to accommodate.

It displays per process processor occupation on my i5 computer as it had only one core. You must divide the numbers by abt. four. The graphical representation is OK, though... (v19.04)

Also it froze when (?) I switched between windows - I don't even remember when other apps hung here...

This is good app; thanks! I've installed it on my laptop and desktop, both running Fedora 30. It works fine on my laptop, but when I click on the "Storage" tab on my desktop, it hangs forever. 

Keep up the good work! I'll be updating this app to see if my issue has been resolved.
summary: Very nice, but hangs on one of my systems

description: must download...shows perfet pictographs

The only thing I've found annoying so far is that the memory section is listed below the CPU data and as entries pop in and out, the UI jumps around which is annoying when scrolling through the list of apps consuming the most memory.
Although it might look simple, it is very complete, and it runs faster than any of the other alternatives in the store
summary: Faster than any of the alternatives

summary: Network ugsage and block the mysterious 200mb

description:
I was looking for something like GNOME's System Monitor but with a prettier design. GNOME Usage definitely is prettier, but it's too minimalistic..?

Also, would it be possible to separate "Processor" and "Memory" into their own tabs at the top? When I choose to "Show all processes", the list dynamically grows and shrinks and so the "Memory" section below keeps moving up and down, which is pretty annoying when you're specifically checking the memory usage.
But doesn't have enough features

I have 240 GB SSD for the entire Linux system.
Usage counted 624 GB for some reasons.

There are two main tabs: Performance and Usage. Performance seems fine but Usage is wildly incorrect. I have a single 1TB drive and it tells me I have 2TB in total. It has also doubled the actual file space used. Possibly related to the fact that the drive is LUKS encrypted, which is pretty a standard and recommended setup IMHO. Tested on a clean install of Fedora 36 Workstation. Luckily Gnome comes with Disk Usage Analyzer too, which does give the correct file and space sizes if you need that.
summary: Reported Double the Actual Storage Space and Usage

description: Shows summary of CPU and memory used by all threads of an application, but most times this application itself consumes around 30% of CPU which is not acceptable.
do not install , comsums 35% of cpu. bitcoin miner, mines bitcoin on you computer

A usage app that take 50% CPU alone? ridiculous. skip if you care about your battery, and if you want to know what uses your CPU because this sofware will always top the list.
